Package lamblin.common.source

The common source package sets up different kinds of iterable sources of lines of text.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    LineSource
    An Iterable source of lines.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DirectoryLineSource
    Reads lines out of each file in a directory.
    EmptySource
    A representation of an empty input stream for LineSource.
    FileLineSource
    Reads lines out of a File.
    InputStreamLineSource
    Reads lines out of standard input.
    NoneToManyLineSource
    This implementation of a line source will provide lines from multiple specified files or directories.
    ReaderLineSource
    Reads lines out of the input Reader.

Package lamblin.common.source Description

The common source package sets up different kinds of iterable sources of lines of text.
LineSource
Is the simple string iterating interface for all lines interated from sources.
EmptySource
Is a no-op implementation of the interface.
InputStreamLineSource
Uses System#in (stdin) as a FileLineSource.
FileLineSource
Reads a default file system file as a FileLineSource.
DirectoryLineSource
Reads all the files in the directory and unifies each valid FileLineSource as a LineSource.
NoneToManyLineSource
Unifies a list of file paths as a LineSource of files or directories.
ReaderLineSource
Is the implementation superclass of FileLineSource and InputStreamLineSource.
